definition: to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: He tried to lie away her reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他極力以謊言毀損她的名譽。

sentences.english: In other words, in high myopia the eye can literally tear itself apart
sentences.chinese: 換句話說，高度近視，視力能夠完全地自身毀損。

sentences.english: The gardens were destroyed by several earthquakes after the 2nd century BC.
sentences.chinese: 空中花園在公元前2世紀發生的數次地震中被毀損了。

sentences.english: And cicadas cry in fall leaves at the ruined Han palace.
sentences.chinese: 蟬在秋葉中哭泣，在毀損了的漢宮裏。

sentences.english: The ship is considerably damaged in her rigging.
sentences.chinese: 這條船的帆纜受到嚴重毀損。

sentences.english: Conclusion Radiofrequency ablation can effectively block lumbar sympathetic ganglion.
sentences.chinese: 結論射頻熱凝術能有效地毀損腰交感神經節。
這個瘋子毀損了藝術品。

sentences.english: Only lesion of the NAcc core, but not shell, can reduce the re-acquisition of morphine-seeking behavior.
sentences.chinese: 只有核心部毀損能夠減少嗎啡成痛之後的復吸行爲。

definition: to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
to order the arrest of sb as criminal/to list as wanted
